qas.question: When did Somerton take over from Ilchester as the county town

answers.text: in the late thirteenth century, but it declined in importance and the status of county town transferred to Taunton about 1366

qas.question: How many cities and towns in Somerset

answers.text: The county has two cities, Bath and Wells, and 30 towns

qas.question: The largest populations of the county

answers.text: in terms of population are Bath, Weston-super-Mare, Taunton, Yeovil and Bridgwater

qas.question: What was the strategic purpose to settle this area

answers.text: strategic importance in relation to geographical features, such as river crossings or valleys in ranges of hills
Chard is the most southerly town in Somerset, and at an altitude of 121 m (397 ft) it is also the highest

qas.question: In which year was Taunton established?
What is the average altitude of Taunton?
What is the largest Urban area in Somerton?
What is the most northerly town in Somerset?
What is the average altitude of Axbridge?

context: Somerton took over from Ilchester as the county town <a0_0>in the late thirteenth century, but it declined in importance and the status of county town transferred to Taunton about <b5_0>1366<b5_0/><a0_0/>. <a1_0>The county has two cities, Bath and Wells, and 30 towns<a1_0/> (including the county town of <b8_0>Taunton<b8_0/>, which has no town council but instead is the chief settlement of the county's only borough). The largest urban areas <a2_0>in terms of population are Bath, Weston-super-Mare, Taunton, <b7_0>Yeovil<b7_0/> and Bridgwater<a2_0/>. Many settlements developed because of their <a3_0>strategic importance in relation to geographical features, such as river crossings or valleys in ranges of hills<a3_0/>. Examples include Axbridge on the River Axe, Castle Cary on the River Cary, North Petherton on the River Parrett, and Ilminster, where there was a crossing point on the River Isle. Midsomer Norton lies on the River Somer; while the Wellow Brook and the Fosse Way Roman road run through Radstock. <a4_0>Chard is the most southerly town in Somerset, and at an altitude of <b6_0>121 m<b6_0/> (<b9_0>397 ft<b9_0/>) it is also the highest<a4_0/>.
